title: Exciting News: OpenAI Embraces Anthropic‚Äôs MCP Standard for Powerful AI Data Connection
body: In a surprising turn of events that‚Äôs sending ripples through the tech world, OpenAI, the powerhouse behind ChatGPT, is adopting the Model Context Protocol (MCP) pioneered by its rival, Anthropic. This strategic move signals a significant shift towards greater interoperability and efficiency in how AI models access and utilize data. For those in the cryptocurrency and blockchain space, this development is particularly relevant as it underscores the growing importance of seamless data connection for advanced technologies, a principle deeply rooted in the decentralized ethos of crypto. Why is OpenAI Adopting Anthropic‚Äôs MCP Standard? The adoption of Anthropic‚Äôs MCP Standard by OpenAI is not just a mere collaboration; it‚Äôs a strategic alignment that promises to enhance the capabilities of AI assistants like ChatGPT. Here‚Äôs a breakdown of why this is a game-changer: Enhanced Response Relevance: MCP allows AI models to tap into a wider array of data sources, leading to more contextually relevant and accurate responses. Imagine ChatGPT having direct access to real-time market data, blockchain analytics, or even your personal crypto portfolio information (with appropriate permissions, of course!). Improved Task Completion: By facilitating smoother data connection between AI models and various software systems, MCP empowers AI to perform complex tasks more effectively. This could mean AI assistants that can manage smart contracts, execute crypto trades based on sophisticated analysis, or even automate DeFi interactions. Open Source Advantage: MCP being an open-source standard fosters community-driven innovation. This collaborative approach resonates with the open and transparent principles of the blockchain world, potentially leading to faster development and broader adoption across various platforms. Decoding the Model Context Protocol (MCP) So, what exactly is this MCP Standard that has both OpenAI and Anthropic buzzing? Think of MCP as a universal translator for AI models and data sources. It‚Äôs a set of rules and protocols that allows AI models to communicate effectively with different systems where data resides. Here‚Äôs a simplified look: Component Description Benefit MCP Servers Data sources exposed through MCP. Makes data accessible to AI models in a standardized way. MCP Clients Applications (like ChatGPT) and workflows that connect to MCP servers. Allows AI to request and receive data to perform tasks and answer queries. Two-Way Connection Enables both data retrieval and interaction, fostering dynamic AI applications. Creates more interactive and powerful AI experiences. Essentially, MCP simplifies the process of building intelligent applications that leverage real-world data, a critical aspect for creating truly useful and powerful AI tools in any domain, including the rapidly evolving cryptocurrency landscape. OpenAI Anthropic Collaboration: A Win-Win? The move by OpenAI Anthropic to embrace a shared standard highlights a potential shift in the competitive AI landscape. Instead of walled gardens and proprietary systems, we‚Äôre seeing a move towards interoperability, which benefits everyone. Mike Krieger, Anthropic‚Äôs chief product officer, aptly welcomed OpenAI‚Äôs adoption, noting the thriving open standard and its growing integrations. This collaboration could lead to: Faster Innovation: By working together on standards like MCP, companies can focus on building better AI models and applications, rather than reinventing the wheel for data connectivity. Wider Adoption: A unified standard makes it easier for developers to build across different AI platforms, potentially accelerating the integration of AI into various industries, including blockchain and crypto. Stronger AI Ecosystem: Collaboration strengthens the overall AI ecosystem, fostering a more robust and interconnected future for artificial intelligence. ChatGPT Integration and the Future of AI Assistants Sam Altman, CEO of OpenAI, confirmed that ChatGPT Integration with MCP is on the horizon, starting with the desktop app and expanding to other products. This means users can anticipate a more intelligent and data-aware ChatGPT in the near future. Imagine: Asking ChatGPT for real-time cryptocurrency price analysis and getting up-to-the-minute data. Using ChatGPT to manage your DeFi portfolio, with the AI assistant securely accessing and interpreting your on-chain data. Developing custom crypto trading bots that leverage ChatGPT‚Äôs natural language processing capabilities and MCP‚Äôs data connection for informed decision-making. While the full extent of ChatGPT Integration with MCP is yet to be revealed, the initial announcement is undoubtedly exciting. It points towards a future where AI assistants are not just conversational interfaces but powerful tools deeply integrated with the data and systems that matter most to users. Looking Ahead: The Impact on the Crypto and Blockchain Space For the cryptocurrency and blockchain community, OpenAI‚Äôs adoption of Anthropic‚Äôs MCP is a noteworthy development. It underscores the increasing importance of data accessibility and interoperability in the AI realm, principles that resonate deeply within the decentralized and open-source ethos of crypto. As AI models become more sophisticated and integrated into various aspects of our lives, including finance and technology, the ability to seamlessly connect them with relevant data will be paramount. MCP represents a significant step in this direction, and its adoption by major players like OpenAI signals a positive trend towards a more open, collaborative, and data-driven AI future. Keep an eye on further developments from OpenAI regarding their MCP plans ‚Äì the implications could be transformative for how we interact with AI and data in the years to come. To learn more about the latest AI market trends, explore our article on key developments shaping AI features.

title: XRP Lawsuit News: Ripple Can Now Sell to Institutional Investors, but Ex-SEC Lawyer Warns of Legal Challenges
body: The post XRP Lawsuit News: Ripple Can Now Sell to Institutional Investors, but Ex-SEC Lawyer Warns of Legal Challenges appeared first on Coinpedia Fintech News The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) has decided to drop its appeal in the ongoing legal case involving Ripple. The SEC‚Äôs decision not to challenge the 2023 ruling by U.S. District Judge Analisa Torres brings much-needed clarity to the question of whether XRP should be classified as a security. Judge‚Äôs Ruling on XRP Sales Judge Torres had previously ruled that Ripple‚Äôs ‚Äúprogrammatic sales‚Äù of XRP on secondary exchanges did not violate securities laws. However, the direct sale of XRP to institutional investors was found to be in violation of securities regulations. With the SEC choosing not to appeal, this ruling stands as a key precedent in the cryptocurrency space. Settlement Details: SEC Returns $75 Million As part of the settlement, the SEC has agreed to return $75 million of the $125 million fine originally imposed on Ripple by a New York judge in 2022, leaving $50 million to settle the case. Ripple‚Äôs Future Sales to Institutional Investors Amid the excitement, one user on X (formerly Twitter) commented that the lifting of the SEC‚Äôs injunction would now allow Ripple to sell directly to institutional investors. The user said that while Ripple would still need to adhere to securities laws, it would no longer be required to go through over-the-counter (OTC) desks and could sell directly to entities like hedge funds or private equity firms. Clarification from Former SEC Attorney However, former SEC attorney Marc Fagel clarified that while the injunction is lifted, the original ruling that Ripple‚Äôs sales to institutional investors violated the law still stands. I haven't gone back to revisit the order. But to the extent any future sales are sold in similar fashion as the institutional sales described in the order, they would continue to pose problems under Section 5 (at least if the SEC were still invested in the case). ‚Äî Marc Fagel (@Marc_Fagel) March 25, 2025 Fagel explained that while the SEC will no longer pursue enforcement of the case, Ripple‚Äôs sales to institutional investors may still face legal challenges under Section 5 of the Securities Act if they are conducted in a similar manner as before. Impact on Ripple‚Äôs On-Demand Liquidity Product When asked about the impact on Ripple‚Äôs On-Demand Liquidity (ODL) product, Fagel responded that the ruling would likely alleviate some of the restrictions Ripple faced, particularly regarding how it could sell XRP. However, he warned that if Ripple were to resume sales in the same manner as those deemed illegal, it could still face legal issues, though the SEC would no longer actively pursue enforcement.

title: Hyperliquid JELLY ‚Äòexploiter‚Äô could be down $1M, says Arkham
body: The trader behind recent ‚Äúsuspicious market activity‚Äù on Hyperliquid that led to the freeze and delisting of the Jelly my Jelly (JELLY) memecoin is potentially down almost $1 million from their actions. Blockchain analytics firm Arkham Intelligence said in a March 26 post to X that the trader attempted to manipulate the system to profit from price movements, withdrawing collateral before Hyperliquid‚Äôs liquidation system could catch up. The trader opened three accounts within five minutes of each other, two with $2.15 million and $1.9 million long positions, and the third a $4.1 million short, to cancel out the long positions , according to Arkham in a post-mortem report. ‚ÄúThis allowed him to build up leverage in an attempt to drain funds from Hyperliquid,‚Äù Arkham said. Source: Arkham When the price of Jelly pumped by over 400%, the $4 million short position entered liquidation, but the open short didn‚Äôt liquidate immediately because it was too large and instead passed to the Hyperliquidity Provider Vault (HLP), which is supposed to liquidate the position. At the same time, the trader withdrew collateral from the other two accounts while having a ‚Äú7-figure positive PnL to withdraw from,‚Äù Arkham said. However, the ‚Äúexploiter‚Äù quickly hit a wall when the accounts, which still had millions in unrealized profit and loss, were restricted to reduce-only orders, forcing them to sell the tokens in the first account on the market to recoup some of the funds. Source: Arkham Hyperliquid eventually closed the Jelly token market at a price of 0.0095, the same price as the trader‚Äôs short trade, which ‚Äúzeroed out all floating PnL on the first two exploiter accounts.‚Äù In total, Arkham says the trader withdrew $6.26 million, but at least $1 million is still in the accounts. ‚ÄúAssuming he can withdraw this at some point in the future, his actions on Hyperliquid have cost him a total of $4,000. If he is unable to, he faces a loss of almost $1 million,‚Äù the blockchain analytics firm said. Hyperliquid has since delisted perpetual futures tied to the JELLY token , citing evidence of suspicious market activity. Other traders have been using similar tactics This isn‚Äôt the first time Hyperliquid has had issues like this. On March 14, Hyperliquid increased margin requirements for traders after its liquidity pool lost millions of dollars during a massive Ether ( ETH ) liquidation. Related: Bitget CEO slams Hyperliquid‚Äôs handling of ‚Äúsuspicious‚Äù incident involving JELLY token A whale trader intentionally liquidated a roughly $200 million Ether long position on March 12, causing HLP to lose $4 million while unwinding the trade. Traders have also begun hunting whales on the platform , targeting prominent leveraged positions in a ‚Äúdemocratized‚Äù attempt to liquidate them. Magazine: What are native rollups? Full guide to Ethereum‚Äôs latest innovation

title: Russian Economist Calls Strategic Bitcoin Reserves a ‚ÄòTicking Time Bomb‚Äô
body: A leading Russian economist has warned Moscow against developing a national strategic Bitcoin reserve , calling crypto stockpiles a ‚Äúticking time bomb.‚Äù Per the Russian media outlet MoneyTimes.ru , the comments came from Valentin Katasonov, the Chairman of the S. F. Sharapov Russian Economic Society and a Doctor of Economics. Russian Economist: Strategic Bitcoin Reserves Talk ‚ÄòLike Laying Landmines‚Äô Katasonov said he was concerned about the need for Russia ‚Äúto take a cautious approach‚Äù to the idea of ‚Äúcreating a crypto reserve.‚Äù Valentin Katasonov, the Chairman of the S. F. Sharapov Russian Economic Society. (Source: Ministerstvo Idey/YouTube/Screenshot) The economist used an allegory to explain his point of view, equating creating a national crypto reserve to ‚Äúlaying landmines‚Äù in Russia. Katasonov claimed that cryptoassets were ‚Äúnot fully fledged‚Äù forms of ‚Äúmoney,‚Äù but ‚Äúrather speculative tools that can pose threats to the economy.‚Äù ‚Äú[Talk about creating strategic crypto reserves] is way of inflating bubbles. If the bubble bursts, everything will be fine as long as the economy holds up. But, regardless, there will still be many victims.‚Äù Katasonov Stores selling Russian products have spread across China, and now Moscow is seizing on the interest with a plan for a major expansion of its own https://t.co/QYYmkpu6rv ‚Äî Bloomberg (@business) March 26, 2025 Economist: ‚ÄòRussian Crypto Advocates Are Fifth Columnists‚Äô Katasonov hit out at crypto advocates who call for the ‚Äúintroduction of tokens‚Äù into ‚Äúthe official economic system.‚Äù He called them ‚Äúfifth columnists,‚Äù and suggested they intended to ‚Äúundermine the country‚Äôs economic security.‚Äù A Central Bank office building in Moscow, Russia. (Source: Dzasohovich [CC BY-SA 4.0]) The economist also cast doubt on other countries‚Äô plans to launch strategic Bitcoin reserves. He noted that ‚Äúwhile some countries, such as the United States, are considering creating Bitcoin (BTC) reserves,‚Äù the process was ‚Äústill far from practical implementation.‚Äù Katasonov concluded that ‚Äúno country‚Äù in the world has yet ‚Äúhad a successful experience launching official crypto reserves.‚Äù Some critics may point to the example of El Salvador, whose government embarked on a bullish program of Bitcoin buying in 2021. However, in recent months, the question of El Salvador‚Äôs BTC-purchasing has come under the spotlight of the International Monetary Fund (IMF), which disaproves of the nation‚Äôs Bitcoin pivot. Russia's oil exports from its western ports set to rise 5% in April, sources say https://t.co/N3vd4ldYMS pic.twitter.com/AMHnfDX0HC ‚Äî Reuters (@Reuters) March 25, 2025 Central Bank Opposes BTC Stockpiling Russia‚Äôs Central Bank has recently ruled out the idea of creating a Moscow-based BTC strategic reserve . The nation‚Äôs finance ministry has also said that the state will continue exclusively buying gold and Chinese yuan for the time being. However, the ministry this month claimed that should the National Welfare Fund‚Äôs level of liquid funds should reach a level equivalent to 7-10% of Russia‚Äôs GDP, Moscow could ‚Äúconsider‚Äù buying ‚Äúriskier‚Äù and ‚Äúhigher-volatility‚Äù assets such as crypto. Russia‚Äôs economy hit 200 trillion rubles ($2.37T) in 2024, growing six times faster than Europe, says Prime Minister Mishustin 4.1% GDP growth in 2023 Disposable income up 8.5% Record-low unemployment https://t.co/za0tpFpDFj pic.twitter.com/8lOueWk0tg ‚Äî Anadolu English (@anadoluagency) March 26, 2025 Regardless, Moscow appears increasingly keen on crypto, with some prominent lawmakers expressing a cautious interest in developing a Russian state-run BTC fund. Some have claimed that failing to ‚Äúrespond‚Äù to Washington‚Äôs plans to create a BTC stockpile will allow the US to take the lead in the crypto sector. In late December last year, Finance Minister Anton Siluanov spoke to university students who asked him about creating a Russian crypto reserve . Siluanov that the Treasury should accept that buying lower-risk assets would let Moscow ‚Äúearn less, but keep its powder dry.‚Äù The post Russian Economist Calls Strategic Bitcoin Reserves a ‚ÄòTicking Time Bomb‚Äô appeared first on Cryptonews .

title: Unveiling the Stunning Truth: Global Markets Dominate Bitcoin and Ethereum Trading, Leaving US Exchanges Behind
body: Are you under the impression that the United States is the epicenter of cryptocurrency trading? Think again! Recent data has revealed a surprising reality: the vast majority of Bitcoin trading and Ethereum trading actually happens outside of U.S. borders. Let‚Äôs dive into this eye-opening data and explore why the global stage is stealing the spotlight when it comes to crypto. The Shocking Numbers: US Exchanges Play a Smaller Role Than You Think According to a recent report from Unfolded, powered by data from Kaiko, the numbers are quite stark. Only a small fraction of global Ethereum trading and Bitcoin trading volume originates from exchanges based in the United States. Specifically: Ethereum (ETH) Trading: A mere 8.6% of global ETH trading volume occurs on U.S. exchanges. Bitcoin (BTC) Trading: Slightly higher, but still surprisingly low, at 11.5% of global BTC trading volume on U.S. platforms. These figures paint a clear picture: the crypto market is truly global, and the lion‚Äôs share of activity is happening elsewhere. But where exactly, and why is this the case? Where is the Real Crypto Action Happening? Exploring Global Markets If the U.S. isn‚Äôt the primary hub for crypto exchanges , then where is all the trading volume concentrated? The data suggests a much more distributed landscape, with significant activity in regions like: Asia: Exchanges in Asia, particularly in countries like South Korea, Singapore, and Hong Kong, have historically been major players in the crypto space. Their early adoption and large tech-savvy populations contribute to substantial trading volumes. Europe: European exchanges are also gaining prominence, with regions like Eastern Europe and countries with favorable crypto regulations attracting significant trading activity. Emerging Markets: Countries in Latin America, Africa, and Southeast Asia are increasingly embracing cryptocurrencies as alternative financial tools, leading to growing trading volumes in these regions. This global distribution highlights the decentralized nature of the cryptocurrency market itself. Unlike traditional finance, which is often centered around major financial hubs like New York or London, crypto operates on a worldwide stage. Why Are US Exchanges Losing Ground in Crypto Trading? Several factors contribute to the relatively smaller share of Bitcoin trading and Ethereum trading volume on US exchanges . Let‚Äôs break down some key reasons: Regulatory Uncertainty: The regulatory landscape for cryptocurrencies in the United States remains somewhat unclear and fragmented. This uncertainty can create hurdles for crypto exchanges operating in the US, potentially driving some trading activity to more favorably regulated jurisdictions. Stringent Compliance Requirements: U.S. regulations are known to be rigorous, requiring significant compliance efforts and costs for crypto exchanges . These stringent requirements can make it more challenging and expensive to operate in the U.S. compared to some other regions. Global Crypto Adoption: Cryptocurrency adoption is a global phenomenon. Many regions outside the U.S. have seen rapid crypto adoption, driven by factors like limited access to traditional banking, high inflation, and a desire for alternative financial systems. This organic growth in global adoption naturally leads to higher trading volumes outside of the US. Competition from International Exchanges: International crypto exchanges have become increasingly sophisticated and competitive, offering a wide range of services and often lower fees. This intense global competition can draw trading volume away from US-based platforms. Benefits of a Globally Distributed Crypto Market While the smaller share of US exchange volume might seem surprising, a globally distributed crypto exchanges market actually offers several benefits: Increased Resilience: Decentralization is a core tenet of crypto. A globally distributed trading market reduces reliance on any single jurisdiction, making the overall crypto ecosystem more resilient to regional regulatory changes or economic shocks. Wider Access to Crypto: With trading activity spread across various regions, individuals around the world have greater access to cryptocurrencies. This broader accessibility promotes financial inclusion and empowers individuals globally. Innovation and Competition: Global competition among crypto exchanges fosters innovation and drives improvements in services, security, and user experience. This competitive environment ultimately benefits crypto users worldwide. Reduced Regulatory Risk: Diversification across multiple jurisdictions can help mitigate regulatory risks. If one region imposes restrictive regulations, the global market can continue to function, albeit with potential shifts in trading volume. Challenges of a Globally Distributed Crypto Market Of course, a decentralized global market also presents certain challenges: Regulatory Fragmentation: The lack of harmonized global regulations can create complexities for crypto exchanges operating across multiple jurisdictions. Navigating diverse regulatory frameworks can be challenging and costly. Enforcement Issues: Cross-border enforcement of regulations and combating illicit activities in a globally distributed market can be more complex than in a centralized system. Market Fragmentation: While global distribution is beneficial, excessive fragmentation could potentially lead to liquidity issues or price discrepancies across different exchanges. However, arbitrage opportunities often help to mitigate these discrepancies. Actionable Insights: What Does This Mean for You? So, what are the key takeaways from this data, and how can you use this information? Diversify Your Exchange Usage: Don‚Äôt limit yourself to only US-based crypto exchanges . Explore reputable international platforms to potentially access a wider range of assets, features, and potentially lower fees. Stay Informed About Global Crypto Trends: Keep an eye on developments in global crypto markets , not just the US. Understanding global adoption patterns and regulatory trends can provide valuable insights into the future of crypto. Consider Regulatory Differences: Be aware of the regulatory landscape in different jurisdictions if you are trading on international crypto exchanges . Understand the compliance requirements and potential risks associated with each platform. Conclusion: The Global Crypto Revolution is Here The data is clear: the cryptocurrency market is a truly global phenomenon, with the majority of Bitcoin trading and Ethereum trading volume happening outside of the United States. This stunning revelation underscores the decentralized and international nature of crypto. While US exchanges remain important players, the future of crypto trading is undoubtedly global, offering both exciting opportunities and unique challenges. Embracing this global perspective is crucial for anyone looking to navigate the dynamic world of cryptocurrencies. To learn more about the latest crypto market trends, explore our article on key developments shaping Bitcoin and Ethereum price action.

title: Pi Network Price Risks Falling To $0.6 Before Pi Coin‚Äôs Robust Breakout
body: Pi Network price has continued to decline and traded below the $0.8 mark amid growing concerns in the broader community. A flurry of factors appears to be affecting the investors‚Äô sentiment, with recent trends and analysis indicating towards further slip ahead to about $0.6. However, despite that, experts remained bullish on the long-term trajectory of Pi Coin. Pi Network Price Slips 3%: What Lies Ahead? Pi price today was down around 3% and exchanged hands at $0.79, while its volume for the last 24 hours increased by 33% to $327 million. Notably, the crypto has touched a 24-hour low of $0.77 from yesterday, indicating the gloomy sentiment hovering in the market. Notably, an article highlighted the key reasons behind the latest Pi price dip . Amid this, market watchers anticipate a further fall ahead, with some experts predicting a slump to even $0.6. However, despite that, the market watchers remained bullish, hinting at a potential breakout ahead. Will Pi Coin Slip To $0.6? A flurry of market experts anticipates a further dip in Pi Network price due to massive token unlocks ahead. According to PiScan data, a total of 105.96 million Pi will be unlocked over the next 30 days, worth around $85 million at the current price. The daily average unlock is around 3.5 million coins. This heavy influx could significantly dampen the investors‚Äô sentiment. Besides, a lack of clarity from the Pi Core Team has further fueled concerns. On the other hand, the lack of major listings on leading crypto exchanges like Binance, which many were anticipating, has weighed on the sentiment. Besides, looking ahead to the next 12 months, 1.6 billion Pi Coins are set to be unlocked, with an average of 129 million per month. This trend is expected to continue until May 2028, with minimal changes. To mitigate this potential price drop, Pi enthusiasts are urging the Pi Core Team to implement measures to reduce circulation, such as burning mechanisms or smart contract features. Expert Predicts Dip To $0.6: What‚Äôs Next For Pi Network? Analyst bullstraders7 on TradingView noted that Pi Network price risks falling to $0.61 or even $0.6 in the coming days. This has further dampened the market sentiment, especially with soaring anticipation over a robust rally in Pi price. However, another expert Coinvo sees this latest dip as a buying opportunity. He said that ‚ÄúPi RSI divergence‚Äù is signaling towards a ‚Äúmassive buy signal.‚Äù Besides, he also noted that the current ‚ÄúFibonacci zone‚Äù could push the crypto to a new high ahead. Source: Coinvo, X Considering this analysis, Pi Network price could hit a new high in the coming days. However, a recent Pi Coin price prediction hints at a potential drop to $0.54 by next month. Having said that, investors should exercise due diligence before putting their bets into the market. title: Trump slaps 25% tariffs on all foreign cars, says Elon Musk was not involved in the decision
body: President Donald Trump announced on Wednesday from the White House that he‚Äôs hitting all foreign cars with a 25% tariff starting April 2, and said collections will begin the next day. ‚ÄúAll cars that are not made in the United States,‚Äù Trump said, will be taxed. He made it clear that cars built within the country will not be affected, saying there‚Äôs ‚Äúabsolutely no tariff‚Äù for them. He signed the new trade order inside the Oval Office. According to a report from CNBC, Trump formalized the tariffs through a presidential proclamation. His longtime aide, Will Scharf, told reporters at the White House that the new rule includes foreign-made light trucks too, and stacks on top of all existing duties. ‚ÄúOver $100 billion of new annual revenue‚Äù is what Scharf claimed this move will generate for the U.S. Trump adds pressure on auto supply chains with parts enforcement Trump didn‚Äôt offer many specifics about how it‚Äôll work, especially considering most vehicles today are built from thousands of individual parts sourced from several different countries. Still, he told reporters the government would launch ‚Äúvery strong policing‚Äù to monitor which components trigger the tariffs. That means federal agents will have to track exactly which parts are foreign and where they come from‚Äîno easy task in a system where even a single sedan might carry pieces from 20 different countries. The move instantly drew backlash from Europe. European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen responded within hours, saying the European Union would continue pursuing negotiations but wouldn‚Äôt roll over. ‚ÄúTariffs are taxes ‚Äî bad for businesses, worse for consumers equally in the US and the European Union,‚Äù she said in a formal statement Wednesday. As expected, the stock market didn‚Äôt sit still. After-hours trading saw shares of General Motors, Ford Motor, and Stellantis all drop about 5%. All three companies have some manufacturing capacity outside the U.S., even though they assemble a lot of cars within it too. Trump didn‚Äôt throw them under the bus completely. He offered GM, Ford, and Stellantis a one-month exemption from the new 25% tariff‚Äîfor imports from Mexico and Canada only‚Äîif their cars qualify under the rules in the United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement, or USMCA. That deal replaces the old NAFTA structure and has stricter guidelines around regional production. The waiver is set to expire at the end of April. The announcement didn‚Äôt come out of nowhere. Trump already warned on Monday during a Cabinet meeting that auto tariffs were on the way. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôll be announcing that fairly soon over the next few days, probably, and then April 2 comes, that‚Äôll be reciprocal tariffs,‚Äù he said earlier this week. The plan is part of what Trump calls his ‚Äúreciprocal tariff‚Äù policy. It targets countries that impose high duties on U.S. goods but expect low barriers coming into the American market. Business executives say these surprise rollouts have made it impossible to plan ahead. Trump‚Äôs trade decisions change fast, and sometimes without notice. Even companies that support American manufacturing say they don‚Äôt know how to prepare anymore. Musk left out of decision, Tesla parts still vulnerable One person not involved in the decision was Elon Musk. Trump confirmed that himself Wednesday, telling reporters Musk ‚Äúmay have a conflict‚Äù and had ‚Äúnever asked me for a favor in business whatsoever.‚Äù Musk is Trump‚Äôs top advisor for federal operations, but this time he had no input. Musk‚Äôs involvement with the administration goes deeper than just advice. He donated $290 million to Trump‚Äôs 2024 campaign and currently leads the Department of Government Efficiency, or DOGE, which is supposed to reduce federal spending and downsize bloated agencies. Even with that power, Musk didn‚Äôt weigh in on the car tariffs, according to Trump. That didn‚Äôt stop Tesla from getting a spotlight moment this month. Trump turned the White House‚Äôs South Lawn into a temporary Tesla display, ordering five of the company‚Äôs electric vehicles to be delivered so he could walk around and inspect them. Afterward, he posted on Truth Social that he was planning to buy one himself to ‚Äúsupport Elon‚Äù and his companies. During the walkthrough, Trump called the designs ‚Äúbeautiful‚Äù and pointed at the sharp, stainless-steel Cybertruck. When asked whether Tesla would benefit from the new import penalties, Trump said the effect would likely be ‚Äúnet neutral or they may be good.‚Äù He pointed out that Tesla has major factories in Fremont, California and Austin, Texas, and repeated that ‚Äúanybody that has plants in the United States ‚Äî it‚Äôs going to be good for them.‚Äù But Tesla doesn‚Äôt build everything at home. The company recently wrote to the U.S. Trade Representative warning that ‚Äúeven with aggressive localization‚Äù of production, certain vehicle components are ‚Äúdifficult or impossible to source within the United States.‚Äù The list of imported parts includes suspension systems, brake assemblies, glass, panels, printed circuit boards, and other electrical gear. A lot of these still come from Canada, Mexico, and China. Tesla isn‚Äôt the only one with that problem, but their international parts footprint puts them in a tough spot. And while the tariffs don‚Äôt directly mention Tesla, any imported part can trigger a tax. The policing that Trump promised would mean border checks could flag individual parts even if the final car is assembled in Texas. There‚Äôs also a bigger fight happening in the electric vehicle market. More automakers are building EVs now than ever before, squeezing Tesla‚Äôs dominance. But not everyone gets to play in the American sandbox. BYD, the top electric vehicle manufacturer in China, still hasn‚Äôt been allowed to sell its cars in the U.S. With Trump in office and tariffs being thrown around like darts, that‚Äôs unlikely to change anytime soon. title: German Financial News Educate Their Audience About XRP
body: Discussions about XRP‚Äôs media coverage have intensified following a recent post by Digital Asset Investor (@digitalassetbuy), a well-known figure in the XRP community. He drew attention to Tokentus Investment AG, a German venture capital firm actively educating its audience about XRP through detailed videos. His post contrasted the firm‚Äôs efforts with U.S. media platforms that ‚Äúpretend it doesn‚Äôt exist,‚Äù fueling ongoing debates about how XRP is presented to investors globally. German financial news educating their audience on XRP while @cnbc tries to pretend it doesn't exist. We see you @SquawkCNBC @andrewrsorkin @BeckyQuick @JoeSquawk pic.twitter.com/4IsGidFT0W ‚Äî Digital Asset Investor (@digitalassetbuy) March 24, 2025 Tokentus Investment AG‚Äôs Educational Efforts Tokentus Investment AG has consistently shared insights on XRP through its YouTube channel, covering topics ranging from regulatory status to price movements. In one of its latest videos, the firm reiterated that XRP does not classify as a security, addressing a long-standing debate that has shaped perceptions of the asset. The discussion also explored the differences between cryptocurrencies and tokenized assets, explaining that while a tokenized stock would inherently be considered a security, XRP does not fall into the same category. By clarifying these distinctions, Tokentus aims to equip investors with a clearer understanding of XRP‚Äôs role in the financial landscape. Tokentus‚Äôs Support for XRP Beyond regulatory topics, Tokentus has continually provided detailed market insights into XRP‚Äôs price trends. CEO Oliver Michel previously examined historical data to assess the asset‚Äôs growth potential. He pointed to the asset‚Äôs 4,300% surge from 2014 to 2017, suggesting that while such extreme growth is less likely this time, a significant rally remains possible. Based on historical patterns and broader market trends, he projected that the asset could rise by 2,000% , potentially reaching $8-$10. The CEO also previously discussed XRP‚Äôs role as the world reserve bridge currency , and he has big expectations for the digital asset. We are on twitter, follow us to connect with us :- @TimesTabloid1 ‚Äî TimesTabloid (@TimesTabloid1) July 15, 2023 Media Coverage Disparities in the U.S. and Germany The community has long debated how the asset is portrayed in media, and Tokentus‚Äôs videos have reignited this conversation. Digital Asset Investor‚Äôs remarks suggested that German firms are actively educating investors about the asset, whereas major U.S. financial media outlets appear to downplay its significance. This view is shared by other community members, with some calling out Bitcoin maximalists. While this perspective continues to gain traction, it is worth noting that U.S. financial networks such as CNBC, Bloomberg, and FOX have covered the asset and related events, particularly legal battles involving Ripple and the SEC. High-profile interviews, including those with Ripple CEO Brad Garlinghouse, have been featured in mainstream media platforms like 60 Minutes , though not to the level that some supporters would like. Disclaimer : This content is meant to inform and should not be considered financial advice. The views expressed in this article may include the author‚Äôs personal opinions and do not represent Times Tabloid‚Äôs opinion. Readers are urged to do in-depth research before making any investment decisions. Any action taken by the reader is strictly at their own risk. Times Tabloid is not responsible for any financial losses. title: Hyperliquid‚Äôs USDC outflow exceeds $340M amid JELLY dispute, HYPE tanks 10%
body: Hyperliquid has seen over $340 million in USDC outflows following a controversy surrounding JELLY, a token that surged 429% before being delisted. According to data from blockchain analytics firm Parsec, the latest outflows happened within hours of the JELLY liquidation event, echoing a similar $300 million outflows seen during a previous Bitcoin ( BTC ) whale liquidation event. As a result, Hyperliquid‚Äôs ( HYPE ) USDC reserves have fallen from a high of $2.58 billion to $2.02 billion over the past 30 days. Hyperliquid USDC outflows/inflows. Credit: Parsec The JELLY controversy began when Hyperliquid‚Äôs treasury assumed a $5 million short position in JELLY. As the token‚Äôs price unexpectedly spiked, the unrealized loss grew to $10.63 million. If JELLY had reached $0.17, Hyperliquid‚Äôs treasury faced a potential $240 million loss. The price spike appears to have been manipulated. An address identified as 0xde95 opened a massive 430 million JELLY short position on HyperliquidX, only to remove its margin shortly after. This action led to a series of liquidations, with the losses being absorbed by Hyperliquid‚Äôs treasury. Another wallet, 0x20e8, opened a long position in JELLY at the same time, which caused the price to rise even more. You might also like: HyperLiquid whale tied to fraudster William Parker: ZachXBT To stop additional harm, Hyperliquid‚Äôs validator committee decided to delist JELLY and force-settled it at $0.0095. The platform assured users that short positions were settled at their initial entry price and that the Hyper Foundation would fully compensate impacted users. However, the manner in which the incident was handled has drawn criticism. Bitget CEO Gracy Chen called Hyperliquid‚Äôs actions ‚Äúimmature, unethical and unprofessional,‚Äù drawing comparisons to FTX. According to Chen, the platform functions less like a decentralized platform and more like an unregulated offshore exchange. #Hyperliquid may be on track to become #FTX 2.0. The way it handled the $JELLY incident was immature, unethical, and unprofessional, triggering user losses and casting serious doubts over its integrity. Despite presenting itself as an innovative decentralized exchange with a‚Ä¶ ‚Äî Gracy Chen @Bitget (@GracyBitget) March 26, 2025 Meanwhile, Hyperliquid‚Äôs native token, HYPE, is down 10% in the past 24 hours, according to crypto.news price tracker . Trading volume surged 443%, reaching $466 million, showing increased market activity. HYPE remains 58%% below its all-time high of $34.96 but is still 284% up from its lowest price. The total value locked in its Hyperliquidity Provider Vault, a protocol vault that does market making and liquidations, has also declined, dropping from a peak of $540 million on Feb. 10 to $195 million as of Mar. 27, as per DefiLlama data . title: BlackRock Expands Digital Asset Team, Adds Four High-Level Roles
body: BlackRock is looking to add more people to its digital asset team as the industry grows in popularity among Wall Street firms. Since the inauguration of U.S. President Donald Trump, big names in finance have taken several steps to expand their presence in crypto. While BlackRock has long been a pioneer in the space, especially among traditional financial banks, the asset manager seems to have more in store. Four roles on BlackRock‚Äôs digital asset team were added to its website on Wednesday, including Director of Digital Assets, Director of Regulatory Affairs, Vice President for Digital Asset and ETF Legal Counsel and Associate for Digital Asset. According to the job description, three of the roles are based in New York and another one in Atlanta. The descriptions have otherwise been kept fairly broad and don‚Äôt give away any clues regarding what BlackRock might be looking to work on in the future. For the role of the legal counsel, the company is seeking somebody who can help with future crypto exchange-traded fund (ETF) launches. BlackRock has so far issued two spot ETF products, the iShares Bitcoin Trust (IBIT) and the iShares Ethereum Trust (ETHE). Other issuers have applied to launch funds for several other crypto assets, including Solana (SOL), XRP, and Litecoin (LTC). BlackRock has not announced any plans to do the same. The asset manager is also strongly focused on tokenization, a sector in which it has quickly become a leading force. The firm‚Äôs tokenized money market fund, the BlackRock USD Institutional Digital Liquidity Fund (BUIDL), has drawn in $1.7 billion since its introduction in 2023, making it by far the largest tokenized fund on the market currently.

title: Wyoming to launch first state-issued stablecoin on LayerZero by July
body: Wyoming is preparing to launch its stablecoin on LayerZero, called the Wyoming Stable Token, possibly by July 2025. According to the official announcement on Mar. 26, The Wyoming Stable Token Commission, which will oversee the launch, has partnered with LayerZero ( ZRO ) to develop and distribute the token. At the DC Blockchain Summit, Wyoming‚Äôs governer Mark Gordon and commission executive director Anthony Apollo revealed that WYST has entered its testing phase. The state-issued stablecoin has been deployed on testnets for Avalanche ( AVAX ), Solana ( SOL ), Ethereum ( ETH ), and more blockchains. These test tokens have no real value yet, but they help ensure the system works properly before the official launch. WYST will be fully backed by cash and U.S. Treasury securities to ensure stability. Interest from these reserves will be transferred to Wyoming‚Äôs school foundation fund to ensure that the stablecoin benefits the state. To ensure it maintains its value, WYST will have more reserves than the total number of tokens issued since it will be overcollateralized. You might also like: Trump‚Äôs USD1 play is ‚Äòdollar expansion,‚Äô not love for blockchain, Ari10 CEO says Governor Gordon stressed that Wyoming is a leader in the use of blockchain technology and that the state‚Äôs commitment to financial innovation sets an example for other states. ‚ÄúOur forward-thinking approach to blockchain and digital asset legislation has positioned Wyoming as a model for not only other states, but the federal government as well.‚Äù ‚Äî Mark Gordon, Wyoming Governor Regarding the choice of blockchain, the commission settled on LayerZero‚Äôs Omnichain Fungible Token standard because it will enable WYST to function seamlessly across multiple blockchains. This lowers security risks by enabling users to move WYST between networks without depending on centralized bridges. A recent test transaction showed WYST moving between Ethereum and Avalanche using Stargate, a LayerZero-powered bridge. However, any compatible interface will be able to support WYST‚Äôs transfers. Wyoming lawmakers have been working on the stablecoin since passing the Wyoming Stable Token Act in March 2023. The commission will continue refining WYST‚Äôs smart contracts and risk management framework. If testing goes as planned, the stablecoin could launch as early as July 2025. title: Best Meme Coins to Buy in 2025: 4 Projects With High Upside & Real Potential
body: In 2025, the meme coin market is showing massive signs of growth. While virality remains part of the appeal, investors are beginning to prioritize fundamentals. The focus is shifting from short-lived hype to tokens with lasting value, stronger mechanics, and community-driven ecosystems. Projects that balance cultural relevance with real utility are gaining traction. In this changing landscape, four tokens have started making a case for themselves: MIND of Pepe, Meme Index (MEMEX), Cheems, and Dragoin. Each one brings something distinct‚Äîbut Dragoin is emerging as a standout by integrating entertainment, scarcity, and decentralization into a scalable ecosystem. 1. MIND of Pepe: Combining AI Tools with Meme Power MIND of Pepe sets itself apart by merging meme culture with artificial intelligence. Backed by over $7.5 million raised, the project uses an AI engine that analyzes market trends, helps with trading decisions, and offers predictive insights. Token holders gain exclusive access to these tools, along with early opportunities that non-holders can‚Äôt tap into. Rather than leaning on memes alone, MIND of Pepe builds on practical value. This combination of humor and functionality gives it an edge. As a result, it‚Äôs positioned as more than just a fun token‚Äîit‚Äôs one of the Best Meme Coins to Buy in 2025 for those who want both entertainment and intelligent investing. 2. MEMEX: Making Meme Investing Easier Through Indexing Meme Index (MEMEX) addresses a growing issue‚Äîtoo many choices. With new meme coins launching every week, keeping up is tough. MEMEX simplifies the process by offering a token that tracks a curated basket of top meme coins. It automatically adjusts based on market performance, giving investors diversified exposure without constant monitoring. MEMEX introduces a data-driven approach to a space often dominated by unpredictability. By focusing on structure and risk management, it transforms how meme coin investing is approached. For investors seeking efficient entry into this niche, MEMEX brings a fresh, organized strategy to the mix. 3. Cheems: Classic Meme, Clear Mission Cheems brings a familiar face and a unique purpose. Inspired by the original ‚ÄúCheems‚Äù meme, the token supports charities by donating a portion of its transaction fees. This built-in charitable element adds a new dimension to its appeal. Community transparency and consistent activity have helped Cheems remain visible across several market cycles. Its long-term relevance lies in its values. By tying meme culture to social good, Cheems delivers more than humor‚Äîit delivers impact. In a time when investors are more selective, this dual-purpose model could give it a lasting place among the Best Meme Coins to Buy in 2025. 4. Dragoin: A Meme Coin Designed for Sustainability Dragoin ($DDGN) is challenging the meme coin model by building a full-featured ecosystem from the ground up. Built on Ethereum, the project revolves around a play-to-earn game hosted on Telegram, where users train digital dragons and earn $DDGN tokens by competing. It connects activity with earnings, making token ownership engaging and rewarding. Beyond gameplay, Dragoin‚Äôs economic model shows strong planning. Out of its 200 billion total supply, 50% is allocated to a 25-stage presale. Each stage increases the token‚Äôs price, encouraging early investment. Unsold tokens will be permanently burned, reducing supply and boosting scarcity. The team‚Äôs decision to fully renounce ownership of the smart contract post-presale adds a decentralization layer rarely seen in meme coins. This structure builds long-term trust in the project. Dragoin‚Äôs roadmap is equally forward-focused. Q2 2025 includes the full game launch, staking tools, and partnerships with key influencers. Q3 will bring listings on major exchanges and additional in-game enhancements. With referral rewards, airdrops, and active social engagement already in place, the project is gaining momentum. What Dragoin represents is a shift. It‚Äôs not just about short-term gains‚Äîit‚Äôs about creating a self-sustaining, community-owned platform. That‚Äôs why for many investors watching the market evolve, Dragoin isn‚Äôt just an option‚Äîit‚Äôs leading the list of Best Meme Coins to Buy in 2025 . title: Dogecoin Prepares To Explode ‚Äî Analysts Say Watch This Price
body: Over the past four days, the Dogecoin price is up more than 17% and is thus nearing bullish territory according to two renowned chart technicians. Rekt Capital (@rektcapital) and Henry (@LordOfAlts), are pointing to what they believe is a major technical setup on the Dogecoin (DOGE) price chart‚Äîpotentially heralding a sizable breakout. This Price Level Is Crucial For Dogecoin Early today, Rekt Capital shared a weekly DOGE/USDT chart highlighting key price levels at $0.159, $0.204, and most critically $0.22. According to the analyst, Dogecoin‚Äôs trajectory now hinges on whether it can ‚Äúreclaim and/or Weekly Close above $0.22‚Äù‚Äîa level he refers to as a green zone of Pre-Halving highs on his chart. Rekt Capital suggests that the recent dip below $0.22 could represent a mere ‚Äúdownside deviation,‚Äù meaning any breach under that threshold might have been temporary if price action stabilizes above $0.22 in the near future. The candlesticks near $0.20 and $0.22 exhibit notable wicks, indicative of high volatility. Rekt Capital interprets these as part of a ‚Äúvery volatile retest‚Äù of the price region around March highs. Related Reading: Dogecoin Is ‚ÄòAll Going To Plan,‚Äô Says Crypto Analyst From a technical standpoint, the $0.22 area seems to act as a pivot. Should Dogecoin close a weekly candle above that boundary, it would increase the likelihood that buyers are regaining control, potentially setting the stage for a move toward higher resistance levels‚Äîsuch as the $0.28 and $0.338 region, identified by two horizontal green lines on Rekt Capital‚Äôs chart. DOGE Breakout Already Confirmed? Meanwhile, analyst Henry (@LordOfAlts) points to a multi-month falling wedge formation stretching from late 2024 through the first quarter of 2025. Henry notes that this pattern bears resemblance to Dogecoin‚Äôs descending wedge in 2024, which eventually led to a breakout and a significant price surge. Related Reading: Dogecoin Price Mirroring This 2017 Pattern Suggests That A Rise To $4 Could Happen On Henry‚Äôs chart, DOGE had been consolidating between two downward-sloping trendlines for several months. The upper trendline connects lower highs since the coin‚Äôs peak above $0.48, while the lower boundary captures a sequence of descending lows. Henry‚Äôs analysis draws a parallel between the current wedge and a similar structure that resolved in a 365% surge which started in October 2024. Over the past few days, Dogecoin broke out of the falling wedge pattern again, possibly setting the stage for another steep rise. Although Henry does not guarantee specific targets, he remarks that last time ‚ÄúLast time it did a similar thing was in Sep 24. 50¬¢ next, then $1.00,‚Äù concluding with a succinct instruction to ‚ÄúTrust the cycle.‚Äù At press time, DOGE traded at $0.19583. title: US Congress Accelerates Crypto Oversight with New Stablecoin Bill
body: The U.S. Congress is moving forward with efforts to regulate the cryptocurrency industry, with a particular focus on stablecoins. A new stablecoin bill has been introduced in the House of Representatives, building on previous legislative efforts. This bill aims to provide clearer guidelines on how companies can issue dollar-denominated digital tokens and set the stage for broader crypto oversight. House Version of Stablecoin Bill Released The U.S. House of Representatives has moved forward in digital asset regulation efforts after it published its stablecoin bill text to the public. The two congressmen, Bryan Steil and French Hill introduced stablecoin legislation, that dictates rules for digital tokens which bind their value to the U.S. dollar. Steil who leads the Financial Services Committee crypto panel stated the bill functions to unite stablecoin legislative frameworks between the House and Senate. The legislation known as the Stablecoin Transparency and Accountability for a Better Ledger Economy (STABLE Act) follows Congress‚Äô ongoing development of digital asset regulations. According to Hill the bill constitutes part of an extensive program to establish regulatory clarity for cryptocurrency operations. He stated that the bill aims to establish financial regulations which require stablecoin companies to maintain transparency while protecting consumers and the system. Senate Stablecoin Bill Moves Forward There has been some progress made on the regulation of stablecoins by the Senate as the bill was moved to the Banking Committee where it enjoyed bipartisan support. This bill has made its way to the Senate floor, awaiting the senate action. Rep. Representative Tom Emmer, a crypto supporter in Congress, noted that even though the two bills are somewhat similar but have distinct features, such differences are not significant and can be sorted out as the bills progressed through the legislative procedure. Lawmakers are looking forward to passing the stablecoin laws in the next few weeks especially following US President Donald Trump directive on stablecoin regulation. Emmer remained optimistic that the bill will be finished by August. This momentum is part of a wider effort in Congress to provide more stability in the regulation of cryptocurrencies so that companies and users have better frameworks to follow. Efforts to Clarify Crypto Asset Regulations Additionally, Emmer also reintroduced the Securities Clarity Act as another bill targeting how cryptocurrencies fit into the domain of securities. This bill, sponsored with republican partner Darren Soto, is to clarify legal uncertainty existing in the United States concerning the qualification of digital assets under the securities law. Emmer thus urged for better formalism saying that business requires legal predictability to the effect that they are able to conduct their operations within the legal framework. Emmer‚Äôs actions are in line with other pieces of legislation that have been made to determine how digital assets should be regulated within the U.S. financial system. These steps are regarded as crucial in offering that legal certainty that many cryptocurrencies and blockchain start-ups have claimed to need to enhance business growth and development. Wyoming and Other States Enter the Stablecoin Market As federal lawmakers push forward with stablecoin regulations, states are also taking steps to position themselves as leaders in the crypto space. Wyoming, in particular, is moving toward launching its own state-backed stablecoin . Governor Mark Gordon has announced plans to issue a stablecoin fully backed by U.S. dollar reserves, aiming to provide a fast, low-cost alternative for digital payments. The state‚Äôs move is part of a broader trend, with other companies and states working on their own stablecoin projects. Custodia and Vantage Bank, for example, recently launched the Avit stablecoin , backed by U.S. dollar reserves and based on the Ethereum blockchain. These efforts reflect the growing interest in stablecoins as a way to bridge the gap between traditional financial systems and the emerging digital economy. The post US Congress Accelerates Crypto Oversight with New Stablecoin Bill appeared first on CoinGape .

title: Crypto urges Congress to change DOJ rule used against Tornado Cash devs
body: A coalition of crypto firms has urged Congress to press the Department of Justice to amend an ‚Äúunprecedented and overly expansive‚Äù interpretation of laws that were used to charge the developers of the crypto mixer Tornado Cash. A March 26 letter signed by 34 crypto companies and advocate groups sent to the Senate Banking Committee, House Financial Services Committee and the House and Senate judiciary committees said the DOJ‚Äôs take on unlicensed money-transmitting business means ‚Äúessentially every blockchain developer could be prosecuted as a criminal.‚Äù The letter ‚Äî led by the DeFi Education Fund and signed by the likes of Kraken and Coinbase ‚Äî added that the Justice Department‚Äôs interpretation ‚Äúcreates confusion and ambiguity‚Äù and ‚Äúthreatens the viability of U.S.-based software development in the digital asset industry.‚Äù The group said the DOJ debuted its position ‚Äúin August 2023 via criminal indictment‚Äù ‚Äî¬†the same time it charged Tornado Cash developers Roman Storm and Roman Semenov with money laundering. Storm has been released on bail, has pleaded not guilty and wants the charges dropped . Semenov, a Russian national, is at large. Source: DeFi Education Fund The DOJ has filed similar charges against Samourai Wallet co-founders Keonne Rodriguez and William Lonergan Hill, who have both pleaded not guilty. The crypto group‚Äôs letter argued that two sections of the US Code define a ‚Äúmoney transmitting business‚Äù ‚Äî Title 31 section 5330, defining who must be licensed and Title 18 section 1960, which criminalizes operating unlicensed. It added that 2019 guidance from the Treasury‚Äôs Financial Crimes Enforcement Network (FinCEN) gave examples of what money-transmitting activities and said that ‚Äúif a software developer never obtains possession or control over customer funds, that developer is not operating a ‚Äòmoney transmitting business.‚Äô‚Äù The letter argued that the DOJ had taken a position that the definition of a money transmitting business under section 5330 ‚Äúis not relevant to determining whether someone is operating an unlicensed ‚Äòmoney transmitting business‚Äô under Section 1960‚Äù despite the ‚Äúintentional similarity‚Äù in both sections and FinCEN‚Äôs guidance. Related: Hester Peirce calls for SEC rulemaking to ‚Äòbake in‚Äô crypto regulation The group accused the DOJ of ignoring both FinCEN‚Äôs guidance and parts of the law to pursue its own interpretation of a money-transmitting business when it charged Storm and Semenov. They said the result had seen ‚Äútwo separate US government agencies with conflicting interpretations of ‚Äòmoney transmission‚Äô ‚Äî an unclear, unfair position for law-abiding industry participants and innovators.‚Äù The letter said that if not addressed, the Justice Department‚Äôs interpretation would expose non-custodial software developers ‚Äúwithin the reach of the U.S. to criminal liability.‚Äù ‚ÄúThe resulting, and very rational, fear among developers would effectively end the development of these technologies in the United States.‚Äù In January, Michael Lewellen, a fellow of the crypto advocacy group Coin Center, sued Attorney General Merrick Garland to have his planned release of non-custodial software declared legal and to block the DOJ from using money transmitting laws to prosecute him. Lewellen said the DOJ ‚Äúhas begun criminally prosecuting people for publishing similar cryptocurrency software,‚Äù which he claims extended the interpretation of money-transmitting laws ‚Äúbeyond what the Constitution allows.‚Äù Magazine: Meet lawyer Max Burwick ‚Äî ‚ÄòThe ambulance chaser of crypto‚Äô

title: EVAA Integrates FIVA to Unlock Fixed Yields and Leveraged Farming on TON
body: EVAA Protocol , the leading decentralized lending platform on Telegram, has announced its integration with FIVA, the first yield tokenization platform on the TON blockchain. This integration unlocks powerful new strategies for EVAA users ‚Äî including fixed yields, leveraged farming, and impermanent loss-protected liquidity provision ‚Äî while reaffirming EVAA‚Äôs position as the leading lending platform on TON. Think of it as Pendle meets TON ‚Äî and it‚Äôs live. With this move, EVAA users can now tokenize their deposits into two distinct assets, opening up access to stable returns, amplified point farming, and composable yield strategies. This also marks the launch of FIVA‚Äôs phased mainnet rollout, with EVAA‚Äôs USDT market as its next strategic integration. One Deposit, Two Tokens ‚Äî You Choose Through FIVA, EVAA depositors can split a single yield-bearing position into: PT (Principal Token): A fixed-rate instrument offering predictable income (e.g., 7‚Äì15% APY over 3‚Äì6 months) YT (Yield Token): A leveraged position offering up to 100x exposure to EVAA‚Äôs variable yields and point system ‚Äî with no liquidation risk This dual-token design gives users greater control over their capital, letting them hedge risk or maximize upside depending on their strategy. Three Ways to Make Your Yield Work Smarter EVAA‚Äôs mission is to deliver transparent, sustainable, and innovative lending experiences. With FIVA now integrated, users can enhance their yield performance using three core instruments: Fixed Yields with Principal Tokens (PT) Users can lock in stable returns, ideal during times of market volatility. For example: Deposit 10,000 USDT at a fixed 7% APY over 6 months Earn 350 USDT in guaranteed returns, fully insulated from rate volatility With EVAA‚Äôs historical rates swinging between 3% and 14% ‚Äî and dropping by as much as 75% in a year ‚Äî PTs offer valuable protection for long-term and passive investors. This mechanism is ideal for investors who prioritize stability and need predictable income, especially in the often-volatile world of DeFi. Leveraged Farming with Yield Tokens (YT) For those seeking higher returns, YT tokens provide leveraged exposure to EVAA yields and points, with capital efficiency and capped downside. For instance, a 1,000 USDT YT position can give the yield of a 55,000 USDT deposit (representing 55x leverage ‚Äì a possible scenario that varies based on market conditions) ‚Äî perfect for aggressive farmers ahead of EVAA‚Äôs TGE. Multi-Stream Rewards as Liquidity Provider (LP) Users can also deploy EVAA positions to FIVA liquidity pools, earning: EVAA base yield (currently 3%) Trading fees (~0.5%) Both EVAA and FIVA points with multipliers Protection from impermanent loss at maturity Each token type ‚Äî PT, YT, and LP ‚Äî serves a different strategic purpose, allowing users to customize their approach based on personal risk profiles and yield targets. Phased Access, Proven Security ‚Äì Rolling Out the Future of Yield The integration of FIVA into EVAA marks the start of a phased mainnet rollout designed with security, performance, and community feedback at its core. The rollout is structured across three stages: Phase 1: Early access for FIVA Genesis Pass NFT holders (completed) Phase 2: Partner access for EVAA users via exclusive links (now live) Phase 3: Full-scale expansion with additional protocol integrations (upcoming) During the current phase, EVAA users can access FIVA‚Äôs yield tokenization features through invite-only links distributed via the EVAA app, Telegram channel, quests, and partner campaigns. This controlled onboarding process allows the FIVA team to closely monitor performance, collect real-world usage data, and refine the user experience ‚Äî all while ensuring protocol stability and protecting early participants. The decision to launch EVAA‚Äôs USDT market was strategic: as one of the most established protocols on TON, EVAA offers a secure and well-audited foundation to test and scale FIVA‚Äôs novel mechanics. Security remains a priority throughout. Both EVAA and FIVA implement smart contract audits, rely on Pyth oracles for reliable price feeds, and maintain contingency protections. Should any issues arise within the EVAA protocol, FIVA‚Äôs contracts are designed to honor fixed-rate positions , even if the underlying token values are affected. By combining phased access with robust security measures, the integration sets a new standard for responsible scaling in the TON DeFi space ‚Äî a space that‚Äôs evolving fast and demanding smarter, safer infrastructure. And this is just the beginning. FIVA is already connected with a growing network of TON-native protocols, including Tonstakers , Storm , Ethena , and Bemo , with more integrations planned. Together with EVAA, they‚Äôre laying the groundwork for a modular DeFi ecosystem, where yield is not just earned ‚Äî it‚Äôs tokenized, tradable, and optimized. Get started earning Visit the FIVA‚Äôs Telegram app or web application Connect your TON wallet Choose your strategy: Fixed yield with PT tokens Leveraged farming via YT tokens Provide liquidity to earn multiple types of rewards About EVAA & FIVA EVAA Protocol ‚Äî the leading DeFi protocol built on TON, offering innovative liquidity market solutions and leveraged staking strategies. With a focus on efficiency and accessibility, EVAA enables users to borrow, stake, and reinvest seamlessly, maximizing capital utilization without compromising liquidity. The platform is integrated with Telegram, top-tier TON applications, and wallets, ensuring a frictionless experience for both institutional and retail users. Website | Twitter | Telegram | TG Community FIVA Protocol ‚Äî the first yield tokenization protocol on the TON blockchain that transforms variable DeFi yields into fixed-rate products and leveraged farming positions. The protocol‚Äôs Principal and Yield Token system allows users to lock in guaranteed returns or amplify yield exposure without liquidation risk. FIVA features a specialized AMM design that protects liquidity providers from impermanent loss when held to maturity. FIVA integrates with leading TON DeFi platforms to optimize returns across stablecoins and TON assets, accessible through both web and Telegram Mini App interfaces. Website | Twitter | Telegram | TG Community

title: XRP Price Rejected at Resistance‚ÄîAre Bears Taking Control?
body: XRP price started a fresh decline from the $2.50 resistance zone. The price is now recovering and might face resistance near the $2.42 level. XRP price started a fresh decline after it failed to clear the $2.50 resistance zone. The price is now trading below $2.420 and the 100-hourly Simple Moving Average. There was a break below a connecting bullish trend line with support at $2.440 on the hourly chart of the XRP/USD pair (data source from Kraken). The pair might extend losses if it breaks the $2.350 support zone. XRP Price Dips Again XRP price failed to continue higher above the $2.50 resistance zone and reacted to the downside, like Bitcoin and Ethereum . The price declined below the $2.42 and $2.40 levels. There was a break below a connecting bullish trend line with support at $2.440 on the hourly chart of the XRP/USD pair. The pair even spiked below $2.35. A low was formed at $2.329 and the price is now recovering some losses. There was a move above $2.38. The price surpassed the 23.6% Fib retracement level of the recent decline from the $2.478 swing high to the $2.329 low. The price is now trading below $2.40 and the 100-hourly Simple Moving Average. On the upside, the price might face resistance near the $2.40 level and the 50% Fib retracement level of the recent decline from the $2.478 swing high to the $2.329 low. The first major resistance is near the $2.420 level. The next resistance is $2.450. A clear move above the $2.450 resistance might send the price toward the $2.50 resistance. Any more gains might send the price toward the $2.620 resistance or even $2.6650 in the near term. The next major hurdle for the bulls might be $2.80. More Losses? If XRP fails to clear the $2.420 resistance zone, it could start another decline. Initial support on the downside is near the $2.350 level or the trend line. The next major support is near the $2.320 level. If there is a downside break and a close below the $2.320 level, the price might continue to decline toward the $2.20 support. The next major support sits near the $2.150 zone. Technical Indicators Hourly MACD ‚Äì The MACD for XRP/USD is now losing pace in the bearish zone. Hourly RSI (Relative Strength Index) ‚Äì The RSI for XRP/USD is now below the 50 level. Major Support Levels ‚Äì $2.350 and $2.320. Major Resistance Levels ‚Äì $2.420 and $2.450.

title: Cardano (ADA) Price Prediction for March 27
body: The post Cardano (ADA) Price Prediction for March 27 appeared first on Coinpedia Fintech News ADA, the native token of the Cardano blockchain, continues its prolonged consolidation. For weeks, the asset has been moving within a tight range, between $0.69 and $0.75. Cardano (ADA) Technical Analysis and Upcoming Levels However, during this period, ADA has recorded several fakeouts, which now appear confusing to traders and investors trying to determine its upcoming move. According to expert technical analysis, the asset remains neutral and is currently at the upper boundary of the consolidation. Based on recent price action and historical momentum, if ADA breaches the upper boundary and closes a daily candle above the $0.76 level, there is a strong possibility that it could soar by 13% to reach $0.85 in the coming days. Source: Trading View However, this rally is currently halted by the upper boundary of $0.75 and the 200 Exponential Moving Average (EMA) on the daily timeframe, which has been providing constant resistance. Despite this neutral price action, a technical indicator called the Bollinger Bands on the 12-hour timeframe appears to be squeezing, signaling a potential upside or downside rally. Current Price Momentum At press time, ADA is trading near $0.742, having recorded a modest price surge of over 0.25% in the past 24 hours. However, during the same period, due to its high volatility, trading volume dropped by 18%, indicating that traders and investors are hesitant to participate in the token. $13.75 Million Worth of ADA Outflow Despite ongoing price consolidation, whales and long-term holders appear optimistic as they continue accumulating ADA, according to on-chain analytics firm Coinglass . Data from spot inflow/outflow reveals that exchanges have witnessed an outflow of $13.75 million worth of ADA tokens in the past 24 hours, indicating potential accumulation. Meanwhile, such outflows from exchanges during a period of weak market sentiment reduce selling pressure and could trigger an upside move.

title: Groundbreaking Wyoming Stablecoin: LayerZero Unveils Revolutionary WYST
body: Get ready for a groundbreaking development in the world of digital currency! Wyoming, known for its progressive stance on crypto, is taking a giant leap forward. They‚Äôve just announced their partnership with LayerZero to launch WYST, the first-ever fiat-backed, fully reserved stablecoin issued by a U.S. public entity. This isn‚Äôt just another stablecoin; it‚Äôs a state-backed digital dollar poised to transform how we think about transactions. Why Wyoming is Pioneering a State-Issued Stablecoin? Wyoming has always been at the forefront of embracing blockchain technology and digital assets. Their decision to launch a state-issued stablecoin, WYST, underscores their commitment to innovation and creating a future-forward financial ecosystem. But why a stablecoin, and why now? Here are a few compelling reasons: Embracing Financial Innovation: Wyoming recognizes the immense potential of blockchain and digital currencies to streamline financial processes and enhance economic growth. Lowering Transaction Costs: Traditional financial systems often come with hefty fees and slow processing times. WYST aims to provide a low-cost, efficient alternative for global dollar transactions. Enhancing Transparency and Security: Built on blockchain, WYST promises enhanced transparency and security compared to traditional payment methods. Every transaction is recorded on a distributed ledger, making it immutable and easily auditable. Attracting Businesses and Investment: By creating a crypto-friendly environment, Wyoming aims to attract blockchain businesses and investments, fostering economic development within the state. LayerZero: The Tech Powerhouse Behind WYST The Wyoming Stable Token Commission didn‚Äôt just pick any partner; they conducted a competitive review and selected LayerZero as the token issuance partner for WYST. LayerZero‚Äôs Omnichain Fungible Token (OFT) standard stood out for its scalability and compliance with the complex requirements of operating across multiple blockchains. Let‚Äôs delve deeper into why LayerZero is the ideal choice: Omnichain Functionality: LayerZero‚Äôs OFT standard is designed for a multichain world. WYST will be available on multiple blockchains right from the start, including Ethereum, Arbitrum, Avalanche, Base, Optimism, Polygon, and Solana. This broad accessibility ensures wider adoption and utility. Scalability: As Wyoming‚Äôs stablecoin gains traction, the underlying technology needs to handle increasing transaction volumes. LayerZero is built for scalability, ensuring WYST can efficiently manage growth. Compliance and Security: In the regulated world of finance, compliance is paramount. LayerZero‚Äôs technology is designed with security and regulatory compliance in mind, crucial for a state-backed stablecoin. Proven Track Record: LayerZero has established itself as a leading interoperability protocol in the blockchain space, making them a reliable partner for this ambitious project. Unpacking the Omnichain Fungible Token (OFT) Standard What exactly is the Omnichain Fungible Token (OFT) standard that makes LayerZero so suitable for WYST? In simple terms, OFT is a token standard that allows for seamless movement and functionality across different blockchains. Here‚Äôs a breakdown: Feature Description Benefit for WYST Cross-Chain Compatibility OFTs can be transferred and utilized across various blockchains. WYST can be accessed and used on multiple popular blockchains, increasing its reach and utility. Unified Liquidity Maintains liquidity across different chains, preventing fragmented markets. Ensures smooth trading and usage of WYST regardless of the blockchain being used. Simplified User Experience Users can interact with the same token across different ecosystems without complex bridging processes. Makes WYST user-friendly and accessible to a wider audience, even those less familiar with blockchain complexities. Enhanced Security Leverages LayerZero‚Äôs secure messaging protocol for cross-chain communication. Provides a robust and secure foundation for WYST transactions across different blockchains. WYST: Revolutionizing Global Dollar Transactions? The promise of WYST extends beyond just being a digital representation of the US dollar. It‚Äôs about creating a more efficient and accessible financial system. How could WYST revolutionize global dollar transactions? Faster Transactions: Blockchain transactions are significantly faster than traditional banking systems, especially for international transfers. WYST promises near-instant global dollar transfers. Lower Fees: By cutting out intermediaries and leveraging blockchain efficiency, WYST aims to drastically reduce transaction fees, making it ideal for remittances and cross-border payments. 24/7 Accessibility: Unlike traditional banking hours, blockchain networks operate 24/7. WYST will enable transactions at any time, from anywhere in the world. Financial Inclusion: Stablecoins like WYST can provide access to digital dollars for individuals in regions with limited banking infrastructure, promoting financial inclusion. What‚Äôs Next for Wyoming‚Äôs State-Issued Stablecoin? WYST is currently live on seven testnets, a crucial phase for ironing out any kinks and ensuring a smooth mainnet launch. What can we expect in the near future? Mainnet Launch: The next major step is the official launch of WYST on the mainnets of the selected blockchains. Keep an eye out for announcements regarding the official launch date. Wider Adoption: As WYST becomes available, focus will shift to driving adoption among businesses and individuals both within Wyoming and globally. Regulatory Framework: Wyoming‚Äôs proactive approach may set a precedent for other states and even the federal government to develop clear regulatory frameworks for stablecoins. Expansion and Innovation: We can expect further innovation around WYST, potentially including integration with various DeFi (Decentralized Finance) platforms and services. The Transformative Power of State-Backed Stablecoins Wyoming‚Äôs initiative is more than just launching a stablecoin; it‚Äôs about exploring the transformative power of blockchain technology to reshape financial systems. WYST could be a watershed moment, paving the way for other governmental entities to embrace digital currencies and unlock new possibilities for economic growth and efficiency. The launch of WYST is a bold step into the future of finance, showcasing how state-level initiatives can drive innovation in the cryptocurrency space. As WYST progresses from testnets to mainnet and beyond, it will be fascinating to watch its impact on global transactions and the broader adoption of digital currencies. To learn more about the latest explore our article on key developments shaping cryptocurrency institutional adoption.

This transaction occurred about seven hours ago and follows Buterin's previous statements regarding the use of such funds primarily for donation purposes.
